cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s Big Bend, then forecast to sweep NE along the U.S. Southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near the Suwannee River–Mexico Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch is posted from Marineland, FL to South Santee River, SC (well north of PortMiami).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Suwannee River to Mexico Beach; Tropical Storm Warning from Anclote River to Destin (Gulf coast).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend and Panhandle, then coastal GA/SC/NC and the Mid-Atlantic during days 2-5.
weather_observation.wind: Only isolated rain-band squalls; tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤3% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Brief showers possible, but organized heavy rainfall swath remains far north of Miami.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk and higher surf along the southeast Florida beaches Thursday–Friday.
